name: Hard I Am Canadian Quiz / Test | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: Corel is Canada's largest software company.  'Corel' stands for Cowpland ____ Laboratories.
questions.explanation:
Research.

	Michael Cowpland also co-founded Mitel, a telecommunications company.

questions.text: What team did Manon Rheaume, the first woman to play in an NHL game, play for in 1992?
The Royal William was the first Canadian-built steam-powered vessel to cross what ocean?
questions.explanation:
Atlantic.

	The 1833 voyage to England from Nova Scotia took 25 days.

questions.text: In what province did the Red River flood cover nearly 2,000 square kilometres in the spring of 1997?
questions.explanation:
Manitoba.

	More than 25,000 people were evacuated from the area.

questions.text: In Canada, is temperature measured in degrees Fahrenheit or Celsius?
'Fifty-Four forty, or fight' was a slogan in a boundary dispute.
Where did the original 'Mr. Christie' come from?
questions.explanation:
Scotland.

	William Mellis Christie founded the well-known biscuit company in 1868.

questions.text: Ojibwa chief Shah-wun-dais was a Methodist minister. What was his English name?
questions.explanation:
John Sunday.

	He worked in Canada and travelled to Britain in 1837.

questions.text: In 1987, what did Ian Shelton discover?
questions.explanation:
a supernova.

	Supernova Shelton in 1987 was the brightest and nearest supernova to be found since 1604.

questions.text: What province was called Terre-Neuve by early French sailors?
questions.explanation:
Newfoundland.

	Terre-Neuve means 'New Land' in French.
